text:
East River, shore and skyline, Manhattan: Sailing vessels anchored off South Street between Old Slip and Wall Street. These are to the left and right respectively.

Early 1900's
Views 1,2

Thomas W. Kennedy Collection
Thru Beecher Ogden
Museum Photographers Association
Grand Central Terminal

title: East River - shore and skyline.

text:
East River, Manhattan shore, north from Old Slip and pier 10, toward the Brooklyn Bridge. South Street is on the left.

George L Balgue

October, 1914
title: East River shore - Pier 10.

text:
37 South Street, north side, west of Old Slip.
September 30, 1915
Wurts Brothers
title: Manhattan: South Street - Old Slip

text:
South Street (right), at the N.W. corner of Old Slip (left), showing under demolition, the old buildings occupying this area. This site is now (1937) occupied by the United States Assay Office.

November 7, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

The same, showing a view slightly northward, to, and including Gouverneur Lane. The East River is shown in the foreground.

December 10, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

The same as No. 1 at a later date.

April 17, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Manhattan: South Street - Old Slip

text:
(1) Fires, Accidents, and Tragedies: A fire at Pier 10 East River as viewed northward on South Street from the foot of Old Slip.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The rising smoke clouds as viewed from a point further southward (at Broad Street). Note on the left the imposing structure of the Seamens Church Institute, at Coenties Slip.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The burned structure, after the fire.

P. L. Sperr.

text:
Fires, Accidents and Tragedies: A fire at Pier 10, East River as viewed northward on South Street from the foot of Old Slip. This set of 3 views show the Brooklyn Bridge in their backgrounds.

August 6, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Fires, accidents and tragedies - [Fire at Pier 10 East River.]

text:
East River, showing (right) pier 10, off South Street, at the foot of Old Slip. This pier was demolished between 1931 and 1934 (see G.W. Bromley maps) to permit the widening of pier 9.

December 10, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Piers 10.

text:
(1)
South Street, west side, at Old Slip, as seen from Pier No. 9, East River.
April 14, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same; and showing a view further northward.
April 14, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as No. 2, showing a closer view. The prominent buildings appearing from left to right are the Farmer's Loan and Trust Co. and the Bank of Manhattan Co. In the foreground (5-story white house) is seen the United States Assay Office.
October 29, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Manhattan: South Street - Old Slip

text:
(1)
South Street, west side, north from but not including Old Slip (left), to Wall Street, as seen from Pier 10, East River. Prominently shown is the 60 Wall Street Tower.
June 19, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at an earlier date and showing in addition the Bank of Manhattan Building. Note on the extreme left at the N.W. corner of South Street and Old Slip the new U.S. Assay Building.
October 29, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as No. 1, a closer and more limited view.
August 1, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Manhattan: South Street - Old Slip

text:
East River, New York's shoreline, south from John Street, showing piers 16 to 11 and 9 to 7, and skyscrapers of Lower Manhattan. They are (right to left); the Bank of Manhattan Building, 60 Wall Street Tower, City Bank Farmers Trust Building and American Sugar Refining Building. Also shown (left background) is Bedloe's Island with the Statue of Liberty on it, in the Upper Bay.
June 5, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

A detail of the same, at a later date, showing an exclusive view of piers 15 and 14 of the Porto Rico Line and the four buildings mentioned in view 1.
September 16, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

The same as view 2, from a different angle, eliminating the piers. The low building in the foreground is the U.S. Assay Office at the N.W. corner of South Street and Old Slip. Also seen are piers 9 (left) and 11.
September 16, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - Shore and skyline of lower Manhattan - South Ferry - Williamsburg Bridge - John Street - [Piers 16 to 11 and 9 to 6.]

text:
East River, at Old Slip, showing barges docked off South Street and part of the Lower Manhattan skyline. In the center appears the 60 Wall Tower Building and on the extreme left; the Bank of Manhattan Trust Co. Building (in part).

February 1, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
title: East River - shore and skyline ; South ferry ; Williamsburg bridge.

text:
39 to 34 South Street (left), at, adjoining and south of the S.W. corner of Old Slip. Also shown is No. 41 and 39-37 Old Slip (right), adjoining and west of the S.W. corner of South Street. The 5-story corner house (No. 39) does not bear any Front Street numbers.

April 25, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: South Street - Old Slip

text:
South Street, east side, north from the foot of Old Slip. Piers shown are Nos. 9, 10, 11 and 12, East River.

August 1, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: South Street - Old Slip

text:
(1)
East River, river scene, showing barges of scrap iron off South Street near pier 9, at the foot of Old Slip. In the background is visible the shore of Brooklyn.

April 30, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A similar view. Also shown is the American Sugar Refining Building (120 Wall Street) and the tug "Cumco."

P. L. Sperr.

October 1, 1934.
title: East River - River scenes - Pier 9 - [American Sugar Refining Company.]

text:
This set of 5 mounts (8 duplicate photos) is an experiment with Eastman's Experimental Paste "F".

January 1938.
title: Manhattan: South Street - Old Slip

text:
UNCLE SAM'S CHIMNEY
SEEMS TO RIVAL NEW YORK SKYSCRAPERS

The camera has done a clever thing in showing the in Assay Building at South street and Old Slip, It's one huge chimney makes it an easy landmark when approaching "ahattan by water. Here in this business like building gold from abroad with alloys in different proportion from that stipulated for our coinage is melted down and refined. Bars of precious metal become available for manufacturing jeweler or the government Mint.
Keystone-Underwood  KG

No Date.
title: Manhattan: South Street - Old Slip
